controlDelay.description: Time between launching the first spheres in a level and the shooter activation in seconds.

finishDelay.description: Time between considering the level complete (win condition met and empty board) and releasing the first bonus scarab.

bonusDelay.description: Time between each consecutive bonus scarab launch in multi-path levels in seconds.

wonDelay.description: Time between the last bonus scarab destruction and considering the level fully won.

ui.description: Defines parameters which are constant throughout the entire UI.

buttonClickSound.description: The sound event that will be played whenever a button is clicked.

buttonHoverSound.description: The sound event that will be played whenever a mouse is hovering over a button.

levelAdvanceSound.description: The sound event that will be played whenever the player advances a level (on the level map).

acceleration.description: The default acceleration rate of spheres being pushed.

foulAcceleration.description: The acceleration rate of spheres used only when the player fails to complete a level.

attractionAcceleration.description: The acceleration rate of spheres magnetizing to each other.

attractionForwardDecceleration.description: The decceleration rate of spheres when magnetizing to the group behind while still moving forward.

attractionForwardDeccelerationScarab.description: The decceleration rate of spheres when magnetizing to a scarab behind while still moving forward.

decceleration.description: The default decceleration rate of spheres.

backwardsDecceleration.description: The decceleration rate of spheres when they're moving backwards.

attractionSpeedBase.description:
Maximum attraction speed of groups of like color being attracted together.
This and attractionSpeedMult form a final value together using this expression: attractionSpeedBase + max(1, chain) * attractionSpeedMult.
attractionSpeedBase.markdownDescription:
Maximum attraction speed of groups of like color being attracted together.
This and `attractionSpeedMult` form a final value together using this expression: `attractionSpeedBase + max(1, chain) * attractionSpeedMult`.

attractionSpeedMult.description: The second value used in the formula. For description look at attractionSpeedBase.
attractionSpeedMult.markdownDescription: The second value used in the formula. For description look at `attractionSpeedBase`.

knockbackSpeedBase.description:
Speed induced when a group of spheres crashes into another sphere group behind it.
This and knockbackSpeedMult form a final value together using this expression: knockbackSpeedBase + max(1, chain) * knockbackSpeedMult.
knockbackSpeedBase.markdownDescription:
Speed induced when a group of spheres crashes into another sphere group behind it.
This and `knockbackSpeedMult` form a final value together using this expression: `knockbackSpeedBase + max(1, chain) * knockbackSpeedMult`.

knockbackSpeedMult.description: The second value used in the formula. For description look at knockbackSpeedBase.
knockbackSpeedMult.markdownDescription: The second value used in the formula. For description look at `knockbackSpeedBase`.

knockbackTime.description: If set, this will be the duration the knockback speed will persist for, in seconds.

knockbackStopAfterTime.description: Only if knockbackTime is set. If true, the speed of the group will be set to 0 once the knockback time is over. Else, the sphere group will deccelerate normally.
knockbackStopAfterTime.markdownDescription: Only if `knockbackTime` is set. If `true`, the speed of the group will be set to 0 once the knockback time is over. Else, the sphere group will deccelerate normally.

foulSpeed.description: Maximum speed of spheres when the player fails to complete a level.

overspeedCheck.description: If true, spheres will never move faster than the maximum speed defined at a given point of the path.
overspeedCheck.markdownDescription: If `true`, spheres will never move faster than the maximum speed defined at a given point of the path.

invincibleScarabs.description: If true, scarabs cannot be crushed by spheres behind them. Instead, they are pushed.
invincibleScarabs.markdownDescription: If `true`, scarabs cannot be crushed by spheres behind them. Instead, they are pushed.

luxorized.description: Enables sphere physics gimmicks specific to the original Luxor game to mimic it better.

joinSound.description: A sound event to be played when two groups of spheres hit each other.

newGroupSound.description: A sound event to be played when a new sphere chain appears on the board.

noScarabs.description: If true, the scarabs will not appear in the game.
noScarabs.markdownDescription: If `true`, the scarabs will not appear in the game.

permitLongMatches.description: If true, the spheres will try to make the biggest clump possible before matching together.
permitLongMatches.markdownDescription: If `true`, the spheres will try to make the biggest clump possible before matching together.

sprite.description: The sprite to be used by the Bonus Scarab.

shadowSprite.description: The shadow sprite to be used by the Bonus Scarab.

scoreEvent.description: The score event to be executed by the Bonus Scarab when it's destroyed.

coinDistance.description: The delay between generating collectibles. If omitted, the Bonus Scarab will not spawn any collectibles.

speed.description: How fast does the Bonus Scarab move, in pixels per second.

trailParticle.description: A one-time particle packet which the Bonus Scarab would emit. May be omitted if no particles are supposed to be generated.

trailParticleDistance.description: Every how many pixels a specified particle will spawn. May not exist if trailParticle is not specified.
trailParticleDistance.markdownDescription: Every how many pixels a specified particle will spawn. May not exist if `trailParticle` is not specified.

loopSound.description: A looping sound event which is played during Bonus Scarab's existence.

destroySound.description: A sound event which will be played when the Bonus Scarab is destroyed.

destroyParticle.description: A one-time particle packet which the Bonus Scarab will launch upon destruction.

destroyGenerator.description: A collectible generator used when the Bonus Scarab is destroyed.

sprite.description: The sprite to be used by the Scorpion.

shadowSprite.description: The shadow sprite to be used by the Scorpion.

maxSpheres.description: The maximum amount of spheres the Scorpion can destroy. When exceeded, the Scorpion is destroyed. May not exist when no such limit is expected.

maxChains.description: The maximum amount of chains the Scorpion can destroy. When exceeded, the Scorpion is destroyed. May not exist when no such limit is expected.

offset.description: The starting offset of the Scorpion, counting from the end of the path, in pixels.

speed.description: The starting speed of the Scorpion, in pixels per second.

acceleration.description: How fast does the Scorpion accelerate per second.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the Scorpion, in pixels per second.

trailParticle.description: A one-time particle packet which the Scorpion would emit. May be omitted if no particles are supposed to be generated.

trailParticleDistance.description: Every how many pixels a specified particle will spawn. May not exist if trailParticle is not specified.
trailParticleDistance.markdownDescription: Every how many pixels a specified particle will spawn. May not exist if `trailParticle` is not specified.

loopSound.description: A looping sound event which is played during Scorpion's existence.

sphereDestroySound.description: A sound event which will be played when the Scorpion destroys a sphere.

destroySound.description: A sound event which will be played when the Scorpion is destroyed.

destroyParticle.description: A one-time particle packet which the Scorpion will launch upon destruction.

destroyGenerator.description: A collectible generator used when the Scorpion is destroyed.

scoreFont.description: A font to be used to display the bonus value on the screen.

particle.description: A persistent particle packet which is spawned when the Net is spawned, and destroyed when the Net expires.

posY.description: The Y position of the Net.

pathIntroduction.description: Defines the path introduction. This is a trail of particles which goes through the map before the level starts.

particle.description: A one-time particle packet which spawns throughout the path.

speed.description: How fast does the trail go, in pixels per second.

separation.description: The distance between each particle, in pixels.

separatePaths.description: If set, each path will be introduced immediately after the previous one finishes. Otherwise, all paths will be introduced simultaneously.
